Temple Data Module API Documentation - 3.0.0All Packages | All Classes | Index | Frames No Frames
CacheLoaderProperties | Methods | Events | Examples
 
Packagetemple.data.cache
Classpublic class CacheLoader
InheritanceCacheLoader CoreLoader flash.display.Loader
Implements ICacheable

The CacheLoader stores the data (bytes) of the loaded images or SWF into the LoaderCache by URL. If the data of an URL is already in the LoaderCache it gets the bytes from the LoaderCache instead of reloading the image or SWF.

View the examples

See also

temple.data.cache.LoaderCache

Method Detail
close()method
override public function close():void

destruct()method 
override public function destruct():void

Destructs the object and makes it available for garbage collection.

When overriding this method, always call super.destruct() at the end!

If you want the object to be available for garbage collection make sure you:
  • Remove all event listeners on this object (use removeAllEventListeners on Temple objects).
  • Remove all event listeners from this object.
  • Set all non-primitive variables to null.
  • Set all references to this object to null in other objects.
When a Temple object is destructed a DestructEvent.DESTRUCT is dispatched from the object (if the object implements ICoreEventDispatcher).

Note: Bear in mind that it is possible an object can be destructed more than once.

load()method 
override public function load(request:URLRequest, context:LoaderContext = null):void

Parameters

request:URLRequest
 
context:LoaderContext (default = null)

Examples
CacheLoaderExample.as

This is an example of the CacheLoader. The CacheLoader stores the data (as ByteArray) in the LoaderCache with the url as key. The next time a CacheLoader needs to load the same url it gets the data directly from the LoaderCache.

View this example

View source

package  
{
    import temple.data.cache.CacheLoader;
    import flash.net.URLRequest;

    // This class extends the DocumentClassExample, which handles some default Temple settings. This class can be found in directory '/examples/templates/'
    public class CacheLoaderExample extends DocumentClassExample 
    {
        private static const _URL:String = "image.jpg";
        
        public function CacheLoaderExample()
        {
            super("Temple - CacheLoaderExample");
            
            // create a new CacheLoader
            var loader:CacheLoader = new CacheLoader();
            this.addChild(loader);
            loader.scale = .2;
            loader.load(new URLRequest(_URL));
            
            // create an other CacheLoader and load the same URL. The image is only loaded once.
            loader = new CacheLoader();
            this.addChild(loader);
            loader.scale = .2;
            loader.x = 300;
            loader.load(new URLRequest(_URL));
        }
    }
}
